messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
need doctor and nurse to tell me what going on with me and to help me get better soon and explain to me about paper work and meds I might need to feel better
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
they dont listen to what you try to tell them, when you try to tell them how you feel and what meds you need they dont wanna try to make you feel better
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
i dont like to sit there forever waiting for them to come into the room and tell you nothing is wrong with you, and they dont wanna order meds to make you feel better, and try to run up big bill too
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
the doctor telling me there is nothing wrong with me when I feel really bad and need meds to make me feel better

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You are quite active physically on a weekly basis. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have been going to doctors for 60 years on and off.  I fill out all of the papers myself and my family.  If I do not understand something, I ask the doctor or nurse and get an explanation from them.  Also, people who I am close to sometimes ask me questions about medical issues, and if I know the answer I relay it to them.  If I do not know the answer I refer them to their doctor or nurse.  I have been in the hospital on and off for MRSA problems and several doctors explained everything about this problem to me and as a result I know a lot about my medical issues.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctor is a very good and honest man.  He is about 35 and has a modern view about many things.  He explains everything in detail and ask many questions about me and my conditions.  He is very knowledgeable about family medicine because that is what he studied in medical school.  I could not ask for a better doctor.  He also treats my entire family the same way.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I do not remember feeling anxious or worried about a doctor's visit.  I am always prepared to hear what my doctor has to say, what he will ask me and what treatment he may recommend.  I am 71 years old and am very familiar with the procedure of a doctor's visit.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have had 14 operations on my right hip due to an auto accident.  I first had one hip replacement that led to MRSA.  The MRSA was difficult to get rid of as I had to have infusions with Vancomicin to get rid of it 5 different times.  In the process, I have been in the hospital 14 times.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I understand quite a bit about medical condition. But if something i don't understand I will ask questions.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
He knows what is good for me. I asks a lot of questions and get good feedback. He is very efficient with hic examination and consultation
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Sometimes i fell worried or anxious is whet n i come back to the doctor for results of my examination or a procedure that is uncomfortable to take.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
About a year ago i haf an issue with my fibroid tumor and i need to have a hysterectomy which was performed.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I always pay attention to what I am told in regards to my health, so I feel that I have a great capacity to understand lots of information in regards to my health. I am competent to make quality decisions in regards to my health because of this.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctor has shown me that she is thorough and caring. In the few times I have thought that she might be wrong on something - it turns out that she was right! As far as I am concerned, my doctor has a great batting average when it comes to health, so I am with her for the long haul.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Waiting for a result. There are times when you may not get a result back for a week or two, and you have to wait to see what is going to happen next. In that waiting time, you have to pick your head up and continue on, as hard as it may be.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I was a smoker, I had seen many commercials explaining how dangerous they can be. I also worked with a lot of people who smoked. Seeing them all begin to cough and hack made me wise up and kick the habit.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and rarely visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel a have a full understanding and ability to grasp health information and to use that information in making decisions.  While I don't have formal experience, I do have a lot of experience with health related terms and conditions.  I have done a lot of research trying to self diagnose myself and others so I understand a lot about the body and certain medicines and how diseases can have an effect on the body and what symptoms they produce.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I completely trust my doctor to give me correct, accurate and complete information and not mislead me.  But I don't fully trust that my doctor knows which medical treatments are best for me.  I take the information they give me and I do my own research and I make my own decisions taking into consideration what my doctor has told me.  I am neutral that my doctor knows what's best for me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am an anxious person in general.  So after having waited in the waiting room, and then waiting again in the exam room as I wait for the doctor to come in I am already getting anxious and worked up.  It's not because I fear what I might learn or what might happen, but I'm just nervous in general about meeting the doctor and the waiting and anticipation helps fuel my nervousness.  I am far more nervous about meeting and talking to the doctor than I am about what might happen or what I might learn during my visit with the doctor.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

One example is when I learned I had thyroid problems.  My mother has Hashimoto's disease which I learned is genetic.  I was starting to experience a lot of odd symptoms like dry brittle hair, constipation, dry skin and being cold all the time.  I did some research on the internet and learned that I may have thyroid problems and recalled that my mother had the same problems.  So I went to the doctor and had it checked out and sure enough I had the same disease.

i have complete capacity to understand all information required to make apppropriate health decisions. it isn't that hard. it is easy to ask questions. they won't even let you leave if you have any doubts.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

they don't really know much more than i do and they treat us all like commodities if they see one condition in one person and the same condition in another person they treat it like the same thing but it is not they are just humans.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

they will want to take my blood pressure and start treating me for something completely different from what i came there for. if you look for something you will find something and that is what they always do they think they are not doing their job if they don't give you treatment for something
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

i got a bump on my gums and my neighbor said it was an abscess and i would need a root canal but i knew better because there was no pain so i waited until it went away and didn't waste money going to a dentist.

my doctor said I am healthy as a fat horse I get check-ups on the daily and II take very good care of my body watch what I eat and I keep my levels on track and I'm hung

I do not have anxiety I keep a straight head on my shoulder I'm not scared of nothing but God I'm a cool Melo headed guy and I will throw those hands

no health issues my doctor told me I'm healthy as a horse my health is very good I eat less calories and healthy things

Depending on the doctor I am going to at the time.  I had breast cancer not to long ago, was very lucky it was estrogen receptive very small the best to have if you have it.  I go every year for mamagram and I am anxious until I get the results

In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I don't have feelings of anxiety when I visit my doctor's office. Since I maintain a healthy lifestyle, I feel very comfortable when visiting his office. I go for regular checkups and I have no need to be worried.

Last year I had to be retested for my mammogram. I didn't get upset, I just scheduled the second test. I figured that they saw something and they wanted to be as accurate as possible. The second test showed nothing.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Well they are there to help you, no reason to lie or trick people unless they have a horrible agenda under their belt to hurt some one. but I trust them very much because they have helped me. Now I wont go to a doctor the doesn't seem to care how I feel or treat me with respect.

Just wondering how things are going to go. If there's something wrong with me. I don't want to come out with bad news but most of my visits are pretty good. I stay real healthy and workout a lot.

I dont really have to much knowledge. just common scense and basic knowledge if things happen. I can tell if i really need to see a doctor or not.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because she goes the extra mile and has ordered tests be done just to be sure of something she thought. She has passion for what she does and has my health and well being as her top priority.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Being in good health and being able to maintain good health. Not wanting to have any issues with my blood work or health.

Recently when my mother was in the hospital I had to explain her condition and the fact that she had MS to doctors and nurses.

I FIND THAT SOME DOCTORS TRY TO GO AROUD WHAT IS WRONG AND   I FIND THE ANSEWER MY SELF AND LET THEM KNOW.ABOUT IT.  THE DOCTORS HERE IN MY HOME TOWN  DON'T KNOW MUCH.  THAY DONT LIKE IT WHEN YOU KNOW MORE ABOUT THE MEDICAL FIELD.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I DISTRUST SOME DOCTORS THAT I SEE, BECAUSE THAY DON'T TELL THE TRUTH AND I FIND OUT FOR MY SELF AND LET THEM KNOW ABOUT IT.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
IT SEEMS THAT I GET THE SAME ANSWER ALL THE TIME AND THAT NOTHING IS BEING DONE.  I KNOW WHAT MY HEALTH NEEDS ARE AND THE DOCTORS ALWAYS SAY SOMETHING DIFFERENT.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Having 3 back surgery's and looking to have my 4th back surgery that I need. I  can't get any one to help me out. I keep on trying every Doctor that I can find.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that I can process information very well.  I have three different illnesses and have to speak to four different physicians or a regular basis.  So I am constantly given instructions on prescriptions and eating regiments. I have to adhere to these instructions or I would become very sick. So I make sure to listen carefully,  ask plenty of questions if I do not understand,  and do everything my physicians instruct me to do.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I completely trust my primary care physician because he has gone above and beyond in handling my illnesses.  There has been times when I have gone in for a routine check up and he sent me directly to the emergency room.  Upon arriving at the emergency room I was informed that my blood level was severely low.  He has recommended me for four surgeries and I have felt a little bit better after each.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Worried that my conditions may have worsened.  I think about how my symptoms have been going.  Whether they have been getting worse and worse.  If so,  that makes me increasing nervous about speaking to my doctor.  I worry that he may put me on more medication,  which I really do not want to do.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was diagnosed with ulcerative colitis,  lupus,  and rheumatoid arthritis. When the doctor informed me that he was diagnosing me with these illnesses,  I knew exactly what they were about and what the treatments consisted off.  So I did not have to taught about the illnesses.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You engage in little physical activity weekly.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I usually go online and look for further explanation on things the doctor or nurse covered that I didn't understand. This helps a lot in determining what the best route for care is for me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think doctors treat all bodies like if they are the same. Just because you have heartburn doesn't mean all patients should get the same pill. Doctors should look deeper into what lifestyle changes they can make and maybe certain prescriptions work well for some but not all.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I really get anxious when I think about my labs coming out bad. The doctor always seems like it is my fault they are coming out bad even though I'm trying my hardest to improve my health.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Before I graduated from high school I enrolled in a magnet program school. This school allowed us to get hands on experience in the fields we found interest in. I always wanted to be a doctor so I got to experience what being part of the medical field was all about. I learned a lot and as a result continue to learn more and more about health care.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and rarely visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think I have enough capacity to understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions because I have background education and job experience that has helped me. Also I know how to use researching to my advantage when it comes to me making new decisions that I have limited knowledge about.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I feel like I can't trust my primary care physicians completely because sometimes I feel like they do what is more convenient for them and don't put my needs as a patient first which is what I believe should happen, they don't tell all the side effects to a medication and some may not even know all the side effects. It's best in my opinion to go out and do my own research before trying anything just because I feel like most doctors really at the end of the day care about making money more than their patients health
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

What makes me feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctors office is the possibility of them finding something wrong with me that I had no idea that I had. It always worries me that I might find out that I have high blood pressure or something even worse that I can't even bring myself to type because its so scary and horrible.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Whenever I go to the doctor. I guess it shows that I usually have no clue until i check with the internet to make sure. I think the internet is a good source to reveal lots of information regarding medical and health issues and it definitely provides lots of information for me to learn about them.
